00021 /*! \file
00022  *
00023  * \brief odbc+odbc plugin for portable configuration engine
00024  *
00025  * \author Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
00026  * \author Anthony Minessale II <anthmct@yahoo.com>
00027  *
00028  * \arg http://www.unixodbc.org
00029  */
00030 
00031 /*** MODULEINFO
00032    <depend>unixodbc</depend>
00033    <depend>res_odbc</depend>
00034  ***/
00035 
00036 #include "asterisk.h"
00037 
00038 ASTERISK_FILE_VERSION(__FILE__, "$Revision$")
00039

00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <string.h>

00046 #include "asterisk/logger.h"

00056 static struct ast_variable *realtime_odbc(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap)
00057 {
00058    struct odbc_obj *obj;
00059    SQLHSTMT stmt;
00060    char sql[1024];
00061    char coltitle[256];
00062    char rowdata[2048];
00063    char *op;
00064    const char *newparam, *newval;
00065    char *stringp;
00066    char *chunk;
00067    SQLSMALLINT collen;
00068    int res;
00069    int x;
00070    struct ast_variable *var=NULL, *prev=NULL;
00071    SQLULEN colsize;
00072    SQLSMALLINT colcount=0;
00073    SQLSMALLINT datatype;
00074    SQLSMALLINT decimaldigits;
00075    SQLSMALLINT nullable;
00076    SQLLEN indicator;
00077    va_list aq;
00078    
00079    va_copy(aq, ap);
00080    
00081    
00082    if (!table)
00083       return NULL;
00084 
00085    obj = ast_odbc_request_obj(database, 0);
00086    if (!obj)
00087       return NULL;
00088 
00089    res = SQLAllocHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, obj->con, &stmt);
00090    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00091       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Alloc Handle failed!\n");
00092       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00093       return NULL;
00094    }
00095 
00096    newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00097    if (!newparam)  {
00098       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00099       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00100       return NULL;
00101    }
00102    newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00103    if (!strchr(newparam, ' ')) op = " ="; else op = "";
00104    snprintf(sql, sizeof(sql), "SELECT * FROM %s WHERE %s%s ?", table, newparam, op);
00105    while((newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *))) {
00106       if (!strchr(newparam, ' ')) op = " ="; else op = "";
00107       snprintf(sql + strlen(sql), sizeof(sql) - strlen(sql), " AND %s%s ?", newparam, op);
00108       newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00109    }
00110    va_end(aq);
00111    res = SQLPrepare(stmt, (unsigned char *)sql, SQL_NTS);
00112    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00113       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Prepare failed![%s]\n", sql);
00114       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00115       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00116       return NULL;
00117    }
00118    
00119    /* Now bind the parameters */
00120    x = 1;
00121 
00122    while((newparam = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
00123       newval = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00124       SQLBindParameter(stmt, x++, SQL_PARAM_INPUT, SQL_C_CHAR, SQL_CHAR, strlen(newval), 0, (void *)newval, 0, NULL);
00125    }
00126    
00127    res = ast_odbc_smart_execute(obj, stmt);
00128 
00129    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00130       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Execute error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00131       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00132       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00133       return NULL;
00134    }
00135 
00136    res = SQLNumResultCols(stmt, &colcount);
00137    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00138       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Column Count error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00139       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00140       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00141       return NULL;
00142    }
00143 
00144    res = SQLFetch(stmt);
00145    if (res == SQL_NO_DATA) {
00146       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00147       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00148                 return NULL;
00149    }
00150    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00151       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Fetch error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00152       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00153       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00154       return NULL;
00155    }
00156    for (x = 0; x < colcount; x++) {
00157       rowdata[0] = '\0';
00158       collen = sizeof(coltitle);
00159       res = SQLDescribeCol(stmt, x + 1, (unsigned char *)coltitle, sizeof(coltitle), &collen, 
00160                &datatype, &colsize, &decimaldigits, &nullable);
00161       if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00162          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Describe Column error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00163          if (var)
00164             ast_variables_destroy(var);
00165          ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00166          return NULL;
00167       }
00168 
00169       indicator = 0;
00170       res = SQLGetData(stmt, x + 1, SQL_CHAR, rowdata, sizeof(rowdata), &indicator);
00171       if (indicator == SQL_NULL_DATA)
00172          rowdata[0] = '\0';
00173       else if (ast_strlen_zero(rowdata)) {
00174          /* Because we encode the empty string for a NULL, we will encode
00175           * actual empty strings as a string containing a single whitespace. */
00176          ast_copy_string(rowdata, " ", sizeof(rowdata));
00177       }
00178 
00179       if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00180          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Get Data error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00181          if (var)
00182             ast_variables_destroy(var);
00183          ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00184          return NULL;
00185       }
00186       stringp = rowdata;
00187       while(stringp) {
00188          chunk = strsep(&stringp, ";");
00189          if (prev) {
00190             prev->next = ast_variable_new(coltitle, chunk);
00191             if (prev->next)
00192                prev = prev->next;
00193          } else 
00194             prev = var = ast_variable_new(coltitle, chunk);
00195       }
00196    }
00197 
00198 
00199    SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00200    ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00201    return var;
00202 }

00204 static struct ast_config *realtime_multi_odbc(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap)
00205 {
00206    struct odbc_obj *obj;
00207    SQLHSTMT stmt;
00208    char sql[1024];
00209    char coltitle[256];
00210    char rowdata[2048];
00211    const char *initfield=NULL;
00212    char *op;
00213    const char *newparam, *newval;
00214    char *stringp;
00215    char *chunk;
00216    SQLSMALLINT collen;
00217    int res;
00218    int x;
00219    struct ast_variable *var=NULL;
00220    struct ast_config *cfg=NULL;
00221    struct ast_category *cat=NULL;
00222    struct ast_realloca ra;
00223    SQLULEN colsize;
00224    SQLSMALLINT colcount=0;
00225    SQLSMALLINT datatype;
00226    SQLSMALLINT decimaldigits;
00227    SQLSMALLINT nullable;
00228    SQLLEN indicator;
00229 
00230    va_list aq;
00231    va_copy(aq, ap);
00232    
00233    
00234    if (!table)
00235       return NULL;
00236    memset(&ra, 0, sizeof(ra));
00237 
00238    obj = ast_odbc_request_obj(database, 0);
00239    if (!obj)
00240       return NULL;
00241 
00242    res = SQLAllocHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, obj->con, &stmt);
00243    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00244       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Alloc Handle failed!\n");
00245       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00246       return NULL;
00247    }
00248 
00249    newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00250    if (!newparam)  {
00251       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00252       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00253       return NULL;
00254    }
00255    initfield = ast_strdupa(newparam);
00256    if ((op = strchr(initfield, ' '))) 
00257       *op = '\0';
00258    newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00259    if (!strchr(newparam, ' ')) op = " ="; else op = "";
00260    snprintf(sql, sizeof(sql), "SELECT * FROM %s WHERE %s%s ?", table, newparam, op);
00261    while((newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *))) {
00262       if (!strchr(newparam, ' ')) op = " ="; else op = "";
00263       snprintf(sql + strlen(sql), sizeof(sql) - strlen(sql), " AND %s%s ?", newparam, op);
00264       newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00265    }
00266    if (initfield)
00267       snprintf(sql + strlen(sql), sizeof(sql) - strlen(sql), " ORDER BY %s", initfield);
00268    va_end(aq);
00269    res = SQLPrepare(stmt, (unsigned char *)sql, SQL_NTS);
00270    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00271       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Prepare failed![%s]\n", sql);
00272       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00273       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00274       return NULL;
00275    }
00276    
00277    /* Now bind the parameters */
00278    x = 1;
00279 
00280    while((newparam = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
00281       newval = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00282       SQLBindParameter(stmt, x++, SQL_PARAM_INPUT, SQL_C_CHAR, SQL_CHAR, strlen(newval), 0, (void *)newval, 0, NULL);
00283    }
00284       
00285    res = ast_odbc_smart_execute(obj, stmt);
00286 
00287    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00288       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Execute error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00289       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00290       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00291       return NULL;
00292    }
00293 
00294    res = SQLNumResultCols(stmt, &colcount);
00295    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00296       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Column Count error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00297       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00298       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00299       return NULL;
00300    }
00301 
00302    cfg = ast_config_new();
00303    if (!cfg) {
00304       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Out of memory!\n");
00305       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00306       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00307       return NULL;
00308    }
00309 
00310    while ((res=SQLFetch(stmt)) != SQL_NO_DATA) {
00311       var = NULL;
00312       if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00313          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Fetch error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00314          continue;
00315       }
00316       cat = ast_category_new("");
00317       if (!cat) {
00318          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Out of memory!\n");
00319          continue;
00320       }
00321       for (x=0;x<colcount;x++) {
00322          rowdata[0] = '\0';
00323          collen = sizeof(coltitle);
00324          res = SQLDescribeCol(stmt, x + 1, (unsigned char *)coltitle, sizeof(coltitle), &collen, 
00325                   &datatype, &colsize, &decimaldigits, &nullable);
00326          if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00327             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Describe Column error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00328             ast_category_destroy(cat);
00329             continue;
00330          }
00331 
00332          indicator = 0;
00333          res = SQLGetData(stmt, x + 1, SQL_CHAR, rowdata, sizeof(rowdata), &indicator);
00334          if (indicator == SQL_NULL_DATA)
00335             continue;
00336 
00337          if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00338             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Get Data error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00339             ast_category_destroy(cat);
00340             continue;
00341          }
00342          stringp = rowdata;
00343          while(stringp) {
00344             chunk = strsep(&stringp, ";");
00345             if (!ast_strlen_zero(ast_strip(chunk))) {
00346                if (initfield && !strcmp(initfield, coltitle))
00347                   ast_category_rename(cat, chunk);
00348                var = ast_variable_new(coltitle, chunk);
00349                ast_variable_append(cat, var);
00350             }
00351          }
00352       }
00353       ast_category_append(cfg, cat);
00354    }
00355 
00356    SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00357    ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00358    return cfg;
00359 }
00360 
00361 static int update_odbc(const char *database, const char *table, const char *keyfield, const char *lookup, va_list ap)
00362 {
00363    struct odbc_obj *obj;
00364    SQLHSTMT stmt;
00365    char sql[256];
00366    SQLLEN rowcount=0;
00367    const char *newparam, *newval;
00368    int res;
00369    int x;
00370    va_list aq;
00371    
00372    va_copy(aq, ap);
00373    
00374    if (!table)
00375       return -1;
00376 
00377    obj = ast_odbc_request_obj(database, 0);
00378    if (!obj)
00379       return -1;
00380 
00381    res = SQLAllocHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, obj->con, &stmt);
00382    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00383       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Alloc Handle failed!\n");
00384       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00385       return -1;
00386    }
00387 
00388    newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00389    if (!newparam)  {
00390       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00391       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00392       return -1;
00393    }
00394    newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00395    snprintf(sql, sizeof(sql), "UPDATE %s SET %s=?", table, newparam);
00396    while((newparam = va_arg(aq, const char *))) {
00397       snprintf(sql + strlen(sql), sizeof(sql) - strlen(sql), ", %s=?", newparam);
00398       newval = va_arg(aq, const char *);
00399    }
00400    va_end(aq);
00401    snprintf(sql + strlen(sql), sizeof(sql) - strlen(sql), " WHERE %s=?", keyfield);
00402    
00403    res = SQLPrepare(stmt, (unsigned char *)sql, SQL_NTS);
00404    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00405       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Prepare failed![%s]\n", sql);
00406       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00407       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00408       return -1;
00409    }
00410    
00411    /* Now bind the parameters */
00412    x = 1;
00413 
00414    while((newparam = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
00415       newval = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00416       SQLBindParameter(stmt, x++, SQL_PARAM_INPUT, SQL_C_CHAR, SQL_CHAR, strlen(newval), 0, (void *)newval, 0, NULL);
00417    }
00418       
00419    SQLBindParameter(stmt, x++, SQL_PARAM_INPUT, SQL_C_CHAR, SQL_CHAR, strlen(lookup), 0, (void *)lookup, 0, NULL);
00420 
00421    res = ast_odbc_smart_execute(obj, stmt);
00422 
00423    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00424       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Execute error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00425       SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00426       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00427       return -1;
00428    }
00429 
00430    res = SQLRowCount(stmt, &rowcount);
00431    SQLFreeHandle (SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00432    ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00433 
00434    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00435       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL Row Count error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00436       return -1;
00437    }
00438 
00439    if (rowcount >= 0)
00440       return (int)rowcount;
00441 
00442    return -1;
00443 }
00444 
00445 struct config_odbc_obj {
00446    char *sql;
00447    unsigned long cat_metric;
00448    char category[128];
00449    char var_name[128];
00450    char var_val[1024]; /* changed from 128 to 1024 via bug 8251 */
00451    SQLLEN err;
00452 };
00453 
00454 static SQLHSTMT config_odbc_prepare(struct odbc_obj *obj, void *data)
00455 {
00456    struct config_odbc_obj *q = data;
00457    SQLHSTMT sth;
00458    int res;
00459 
00460    res = SQLAllocHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, obj->con, &sth);
00461    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00462       if (option_verbose > 3)
00463          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Failure in AllocStatement %d\n", res);
00464       return NULL;
00465    }
00466 
00467    res = SQLPrepare(sth, (unsigned char *)q->sql, SQL_NTS);
00468    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00469       if (option_verbose > 3)
00470          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Error in PREPARE %d\n", res);
00471       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, sth);
00472       return NULL;
00473    }
00474 
00475    SQLBindCol(sth, 1, SQL_C_ULONG, &q->cat_metric, sizeof(q->cat_metric), &q->err);
00476    SQLBindCol(sth, 2, SQL_C_CHAR, q->category, sizeof(q->category), &q->err);
00477    SQLBindCol(sth, 3, SQL_C_CHAR, q->var_name, sizeof(q->var_name), &q->err);
00478    SQLBindCol(sth, 4, SQL_C_CHAR, q->var_val, sizeof(q->var_val), &q->err);
00479 
00480    return sth;
00481 }
00482 
00483 static struct ast_config *config_odbc(const char *database, const char *table, const char *file, struct ast_config *cfg, int withcomments)
00484 {
00485    struct ast_variable *new_v;
00486    struct ast_category *cur_cat;
00487    int res = 0;
00488    struct odbc_obj *obj;
00489    char sqlbuf[1024] = "";
00490    char *sql = sqlbuf;
00491    size_t sqlleft = sizeof(sqlbuf);
00492    unsigned int last_cat_metric = 0;
00493    SQLSMALLINT rowcount = 0;
00494    SQLHSTMT stmt;
00495    char last[128] = "";
00496    struct config_odbc_obj q;
00497 
00498    memset(&q, 0, sizeof(q));
00499 
00500    if (!file || !strcmp (file, "res_config_odbc.conf"))
00501       return NULL;      /* cant configure myself with myself ! */
00502 
00503    obj = ast_odbc_request_obj(database, 0);
00504    if (!obj)
00505       return NULL;
00506 
00507    ast_build_string(&sql, &sqlleft, "SELECT cat_metric, category, var_name, var_val FROM %s ", table);
00508    ast_build_string(&sql, &sqlleft, "WHERE filename='%s' AND commented=0 ", file);
00509    ast_build_string(&sql, &sqlleft, "ORDER BY cat_metric DESC, var_metric ASC, category, var_name ");
00510    q.sql = sqlbuf;
00511 
00512    stmt = ast_odbc_prepare_and_execute(obj, config_odbc_prepare, &q);
00513 
00514    if (!stmt) {
00515       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL select error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00516       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00517       return NULL;
00518    }
00519 
00520    res = SQLNumResultCols(stmt, &rowcount);
00521 
00522    if ((res != SQL_SUCCESS) && (res != SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO)) {
00523       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SQL NumResultCols error!\n[%s]\n\n", sql);
00524       SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00525       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00526       return NULL;
00527    }
00528 
00529    if (!rowcount) {
00530       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "found nothing\n");
00531       ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00532       return cfg;
00533    }
00534 
00535    cur_cat = ast_config_get_current_category(cfg);
00536 
00537    while ((res = SQLFetch(stmt)) != SQL_NO_DATA) {
00538       if (!strcmp (q.var_name, "#include")) {
00539          if (!ast_config_internal_load(q.var_val, cfg, 0)) {
00540             SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00541             ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00542             return NULL;
00543          }
00544          continue;
00545       } 
00546       if (strcmp(last, q.category) || last_cat_metric != q.cat_metric) {
00547          cur_cat = ast_category_new(q.category);
00548          if (!cur_cat) {
00549             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Out of memory!\n");
00550             break;
00551          }
00552          strcpy(last, q.category);
00553          last_cat_metric   = q.cat_metric;
00554          ast_category_append(cfg, cur_cat);
00555       }
00556 
00557       new_v = ast_variable_new(q.var_name, q.var_val);
00558       ast_variable_append(cur_cat, new_v);
00559    }
00560 
00561    SQLFreeHandle(SQL_HANDLE_STMT, stmt);
00562    ast_odbc_release_obj(obj);
00563    return cfg;
00564 }
00565 
00566 static struct ast_config_engine odbc_engine = {
00567    .name = "odbc",
00568    .load_func = config_odbc,
00569    .realtime_func = realtime_odbc,
00570    .realtime_multi_func = realtime_multi_odbc,
00571    .update_func = update_odbc
00572 };
00573 
00574 static int unload_module (void)
00575 {
00576    ast_module_user_hangup_all();
00577    ast_config_engine_deregister(&odbc_engine);
00578    if (option_verbose)
00579       ast_verbose("res_config_odbc unloaded.\n");
00580    return 0;
00581 }
00582 
00583 static int load_module (void)
00584 {
00585    ast_config_engine_register(&odbc_engine);
00586    if (option_verbose)
00587       ast_verbose("res_config_odbc loaded.\n");
00588    return 0;
00589 }
00590 
00591 AST_MODULE_INFO(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS, "ODBC Configuration",
00592       .load = load_module,
00593       .unload = unload_module,
00594       );
